Anyway, Clinton, or Obama for that matter, could have killed bin Ladin anytime he wanted - they had an entire fleet of UN black helicopters at his disposal for secret missions.... By the way, in 1998 Clinton did fire a cruise missile at a camp for the express purpose of trying to kill bin Ladin - that's public record, part of the 9/11 Commission Report, undisputed by any respected official, Republican or Democrat. Clinton fired a cruise missile at bin Ladin in the effort to kill him. What did George Bush do? He went on vacation, and when warned of an immediate threat, didn't bother to interrupt his vacation.....that's a fact.

Message.Title: Fed may need to let inflation rise to boost jobs: Kocherlakota....
Message.Msg: Folks Kocherlakota is the Minneapolis Federal Reserve Bank Governor and is preparing the groundwork for sustained stimulus going into Q4/2013 and Q1/2014 (Just Bing the title for details).... IN a nutshell, he wants to let inflation run high for several quarters (as we can see there is hardly any inflation now) till the jobless rate falls to 6% level and keep the stimulus intact for several months so to make sure it can not be reversed.... The Market will continue uptrend come Monday as Bernanke is due to make a speech tomorrow at Princeton and hope he would assure the Market that Fed will keep the current Bond purchases intact till we get the unemployment down even if the inflation hits 4-5%. Cheers Osso

Topic.Title: Fed may need to let inflation rise to boost jobs: Kocherlakota....

Message.Msg: Bernanke has placed the nation at a "Catch-22" thanks to apparent direction or at least agreement from the dolt in chief. With $17T in debt the interest rise could easily overwhelm the smoke and mirrors put into place so goofs think we are recovering.

Message.Title: tha way it works in an old mining town
Message.Msg: Company moves in and the jobs are good, the pay is good too. Company puts its own stores up to serve its employees. Most people begin work at the company. Company converts dollars to company buks. Original stores close down and move out. Townspeople pay more for their items while the company lowers wages. Company stores begin to fail as the original company buks from the conversion are used up. Company begins direct barter of work for necessary items. One day one loaf of bread. Most in the town wish the company had never shown up, but it is too late to do anything as the company drained the wealth.

Message.Title: WINDOZE 8 HAS KILLED THE PC MARKET
Message.Msg: A reminder from back in April.... Recession had also led companies to put back renewal of their PCs, IDC said. The firm’s vice president, Bob O’Donnell, said: “Unfortunately, it seems clear that the Windows 8 launch not only didn’t provide a positive boost to the PC market, but appears to have slowed the market.” Windows 8 is designed to work well with touch-sensitive screens, but the displays add to the cost of a PC. Together, the changes and higher prices “have made PCs a less attractive alternative to dedicated tablets and other competitive devices,” Mr O’Donnell said. Microsoft was not immediately available for comment.
